column4: how do i get kmz files i click on in google earth to open up in the same instance of google earth? (perhaps this has to do with the firefox browser?)
i think you need to set firefox to open new links in the same instance
i have only one firefox window.
edit -> preferences -> tabs -> "New pages should be opened in:" - "a now tab"  *check*
if you do _not_ want it to be a new tab, do _not_ set it to "new tab"  ;)
ah! sorry, it's a google earth issue
yes, i think it's a google earth issue. But i don't think it's a specific issue with google earth. It's more of an ubuntu issue.
ff is able to chech if there's another instance running when it fires up, apparently your google earth doesn't do that, and if you can not set it up to do that you're out of luck
no, ubuntu has absolutely no way to force prog instances to behave certain way
(ie force prog to open file in existing instance, it's an issue of the specific program to handle the situation)
behavior of a program from the point os gives control to it is solely depending on the program (not quite really, but close enough in this context)
but back to the issue, the OS does _not_ handle anyting internal to a program if the program doesn't ask the OS to do it
apparently pretty much the first thing ff does is to check if there is another ff runnin and hand the given url to it and shut down
